snippet: Political jousting between Mitt Romney and President Obama has brought new attention to the public financing of television and radio and has turned it into an election issue.
abstract: Political jousting between Mitt Romney and Pres Obama over Romney's pledge to cut PBS funding has brought new attention to the public financing of television and radio, turning it into an unexpected election issue.

byline.original: By BRIAN STELTER and ELIZABETH JENSEN

lead_paragraph: Political jousting between Mitt Romney and President Obama has brought new attention to the public financing of television and radio and has turned it into an election issue.

headline.seo: Romney’s Pledge Puts Public Television in Spotlight
headline.main: Romney’s Pledge Puts Focus on Public TV
headline.print_headline: Romney’s Pledge Puts Focus on Public TV
